titleInfo.title: Portrait of Adelicia Acklen with her horse Bucephalus, Belmont Mansion, Nashville, Tennessee, 1979 December

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: Oil on canvas painting of Adelicia Acklen with her horse Bucephalus, by the artist William Browning Cooper (created circa 1845) at the Belmont Mansion, circa December 1979. Adelicia Hayes was born in Nashville, March 15, 1817 to Oliver Bliss Hayes and Sarah Clements Hightower. She attended the Nashville Female Academy. In 1849, Adelicia Hayes Franklin married Joseph Alexander Smith Acklen, a young attorney from Alabama, and they immediately began construciton of Belle Monte (Belmont) on 180 acres in Davidson County, Tennessee. It was completed by 1853 as an Italian villa style summer home. Adelicia survived two husbands, married a third time and died in 1887. This historic mansion is located on the campus of Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee. Forms part of the Claynita Harris Slide Collection. The original is a 35 mm color transparency (2 x 2 in. slide mount)
